project.name: AlloyEditor
project.description: An WYSIWYG built on top of CKEditor, with completely rewritten UI

CKEDITOR.tools.name: CKEDITOR.tools
CKEDITOR.tools.description: CKEDITOR.tools class utility which adds additional methods to those of CKEditor.

CKEDITOR.Link.name: CKEDITOR.Link
CKEDITOR.Link.description: Link class utility. Provides methods for create, delete and update links.

params.name: The
params.description: CKEditor instance.

CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion
CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion.description:
SelectionRegion utility class which provides metadata about the selection. The metadata may be the start and end
rectangles, caret region, etc. **This class is not intended to be used standalone. Its functions will
be merged into each editor instance, so the developer may use them directly via the editor, without making
an instance of this class**.

CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore
CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore.description:
UICore class which will handle user interactions with the editor. These interactions
might be triggered via mouse, keyboard or touch devices. The class fill fire an event via
CKEditor's event system - "editorInteraction". The UI may listen to this event and
execute some actions - for example to show/hide toolbars.

By default if user presses the Esc key, 'editorInteraction' event won't be fired. However, this behaviour can be changed
by setting {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore/allowEsc:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}} config property in editor's configuration to true.

CKEDITOR.plugins.dropimages.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.dropimages
CKEDITOR.plugins.dropimages.description:
CKEditor plugin which allows Drag&Drop of images directly into the edit area. The image will be encoded
as Data URI.

CKEDITOR.plugins.placeholder.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.placeholder
CKEDITOR.plugins.placeholder.description:
CKEditor plugin which allows adding a placeholder to the editor. In this case, if there
is no content to the editor, there will be hint to the user.

AlloyEditor.name: AlloyEditor
AlloyEditor.description:
YUI3 Adapter for CKEditor. This class provides YUI3 like way of creating instances of
CKEditor and passing configuration paramters to it.

ButtonA.name: ButtonA
ButtonA.description: The ButtonA class provides functionality for creating a link button.

ButtonBase.name: ButtonBase

ButtonEm.name: ButtonEm
ButtonEm.description:
The ButtonEm class provides functionality for applying "em" (emphasize, italic) style
to the selection.

ButtonH1.name: ButtonH1
ButtonH1.description:
The ButtonH1 class provides functionality for applying HTML heading, level 1
to the selection.

ButtonH2.name: ButtonH2
ButtonH2.description:
The ButtonH2 class provides functionality for applying HTML heading, level 2
to the selection.

ButtonImage.name: ButtonImage
ButtonImage.description: The ButtonImage class provides functionality for adding an image to the editor.

ButtonLeft.name: ButtonLeft
ButtonLeft.description: The ButtonLeft class provides functionality for changing the alignment of an image.

ButtonRight.name: ButtonRight
ButtonRight.description: The ButtonRight class provides functionality for changing the alignment of an image.

ButtonStrong.name: ButtonStrong
ButtonStrong.description: The ButtonStrong class provides functionality for applying "strong" (bold) style to a text selection.

ButtonTwitter.name: ButtonTwitter
ButtonTwitter.description: The ButtonTwitter class provides functionality for sending tweets based on the selected text.

ButtonU.name: ButtonU
ButtonU.description:
Button Underline. A standard AlloyUI/YUI class which allows to apply underline style to
editor selection. Extends Y.Plugin.Base and mixes Y.ButtonBase extension.

LinkTooltip.name: LinkTooltip
LinkTooltip.description:
The LinkTooltip class provides functionality for showing tooltip over link elements in editor.
The class will be also registered as CKEDITOR plugin - {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.linktooltip"}}{{/crossLink}}

CKEDITOR.plugins.linktooltip.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.linktooltip
CKEDITOR.plugins.linktooltip.description:
CKEDITOR plugin which allows displaying tooltip over links in the editor.
Internally it uses {{#crossLink "LinkTooltip"}}{{/crossLink}}. You may specify all
properties which {{#crossLink "LinkTooltip"}}{{/crossLink}} accepts via editor.config.linktooltip property.

CKEDITOR.plugins.uiloader.name: CKEDITOR.plugins.uiloader
CKEDITOR.plugins.uiloader.description:
The CKEDITOR.plugins.uiloader plugin loads the editor UI on demand, depending on the
configuration of the Toolbars and Buttons.

ToolbarAdd.name: ToolbarAdd
ToolbarAdd.description: The ToolbarAdd class provides functionality for adding content to the editor.

ToolbarAddItems.name: ToolbarAddItems
ToolbarAddItems.description:
The ToolbarAddItems class hosts buttons for adding content to the current editor instance. This class is intended to be
used internally by {{#crossLink "ToolbarAdd"}}{{/crossLink}} class.

ToolbarBase.name: ToolbarBase
ToolbarBase.description: The ToolbarBase extension is a common base for all AlloyEditor's Toolbars.

ToolbarImage.name: ToolbarImage
ToolbarImage.description: The ToolbarImage class hosts the buttons for aligning and manipulating an image.

ToolbarStyles.name: ToolbarStyles
ToolbarStyles.description: The ToolbarStyles class hosts the buttons for styling text selection.

classitems.description:
Debounce util function. If a function execution is expensive, it might be debounced. This means
that it will be executed after some amount of time after its last call. For example, if we attach a
a function on scroll event, it might be called hundreds times per second. In this case it may be
debounced with, let's say 100ms. The real execution of this function will happen 100ms after last
scroll event.
classitems.name: debounce

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback which has to be called after given timeout.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout in milliseconds after which the callback will be called.

params.name: context
params.description: The context in which the callback will be called. This argument is optional.

params.name: args
params.description: An array of arguments which the callback will receive.

classitems.description: Create a link with given URI as href.
classitems.name: create

params.name: URI
params.description: The URI of the link.

params.name: attrs
params.description: A config object with link attributes. These might be arbitrary DOM attributes.

classitems.description: Retrieves a link from the current selection.
classitems.name: getFromSelection

return.description: The retrieved link or null if not found.

classitems.description: Removes a link from the editor.

params.name: link
params.description: The link element which link style should be removed.

classitems.name: remove

classitems.description: Updates the href of an already existing link.

params.name: URI
params.description: The new URI of the link.

params.name: link
params.description: The link element which href should be removed.

classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Creates selection from two points in page coordinates.
classitems.name: createSelectionFromPoint

params.name: x
params.description: X point in page coordinates.

params.name: y
params.description: Y point in page coordinates.

classitems.description: Creates selection from range. A range consists from two points in page coordinates.
classitems.name: createSelectionFromRange

params.name: startX
params.description: X coordinate of the first point.

params.name: startY
params.description: Y coordinate of the first point.

params.name: endX
params.description: X coordinate of the second point.

params.name: endY
params.description: Y coordinate of the second point.

classitems.description: Returns the region of the current position of the caret. The points are in page coordinates.
classitems.name: getCaretRegion

return.description:
Returns object with the following properties:
- bottom
- left
- right
- top

classitems.description: Returns data for the current selection.
classitems.name: getSelectionData

return.description:
Returns object with the following data:
- element - The currently selected element, if any
- text - The selected text
- region - The data, returned from {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion/getSelectionRegion:method"}}{{/crossLink}}

classitems.description: Returns the region of the current selection.
classitems.name: getSelectionRegion

return.description:
Returns object which is being returned from
{{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion/getClientRectsRegion:method"}}{{/crossLink}} with three more properties:
- direction - the direction of the selection. Can be one of these:
  1. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
  2. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_BOTTOM_TO_TOP
- height - The height of the selection region
- width - The width of the selection region

classitems.description: Returns true if the current selection is empty, false otherwise.
classitems.name: isSelectionEmpty

return.description: Returns true if the current selection is empty, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Returns object with data about the [client rectangles](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element.getClientRects) of the selection,
normalized across browses. All offsets below are in page coordinates.
classitems.name: getClientRectsRegion

return.description:
Returns object with the following data:
- bottom - bottom offset of all client rectangles
- left - left offset of all client rectangles
- right - right offset of all client rectangles
- top - top offset of all client rectangles
- startRect - An Object, which contains the following information:
    + bottom - bottom offset
    + height - the height of the rectangle
    + left - left offset of the selection
    + right - right offset of the selection
    + top - top offset of the selection
    + width - the width of the rectangle
- endRect - An Object, which contains the following information:
    + bottom - bottom offset
    + height - the height of the rectangle
    + left - left offset of the selection
    + right - right offset of the selection
    + top - top offset of the selection
    + width - the width of the rectangle

classitems.description: Retrieves document scrollX and scrollY in an array.
classitems.name: _getDocScrollXY

return.description: Returns an array with two items - document scrollX and scrollY in page coordinates.

classitems.description:
Retrieves the direction of the selection. The direction is from top to bottom or from bottom to top.
For IE < 9 it is not possible, so the direction for these browsers will be always CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM.
classitems.name: _getSelectionDirection

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the SelectionRegion plugin.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editor
params.description: The current CKEditor instance.

classitems.description:
Returns a new object containing all of the properties of all the supplied
objects. The properties from later objects will overwrite those in earlier
objects.

Passing in a single object will create a shallow copy of it.
classitems.name: merge

params.name: objects
params.description: One or more objects to merge.

return.description: A new merged object.

classitems.description:
Extends an object with another one. Sets the constructor, prototype and superclass properties
to support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.
This method should be called "extend", but CKEDITOR.tools already have another function with the
same name, which does something completely different.
classitems.name: inherit

params.name: child
params.description: The child object which should extend the parent.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent object from which the child should extend.

params.name: overrides
params.description:
Object with properties, which should be added to child's prototype.
If child's prototype already contains some property, it will be overwritten.

params.name: staticProperties
params.description:
Object with properties, which will be added as static
properties to the child object. If child already contains some of these properties, it will be
overwritten.

return.description: The extended object.

classitems.description:
Fired when user interacts somehow with the browser. This may be clicking with the mouse, pressing keyboard button,
or touching screen. This even will be not fired after each interaction. It will be debounced. By default the timeout
is 50ms. This value can be overwritten via {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore/timeout:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}
property of editor's configuration, like: editor.config.uicore.timeout = 100
classitems.name: editorInteraction

params.name: data

classitems.description:
If set to true, the editor will still fire {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore/editorInteraction:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event,
if user presses Esc key.
classitems.name: allowEsc

classitems.description:
Specifies the default timeout after which the {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.uicore/editorInteraction:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event
will be fired.
classitems.name: timeout

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the UICore plugin.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editor
params.description: The current CKEditor instance.

classitems.description:
Initialization of the plugin, part of CKEditor plugin lifecycle.
The function registers a 'dragenter', 'dragover' and 'drop' events on the editing area.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editor
params.description: The current editor instance

classitems.description:
Accepts an array of dropped files to the editor. Then, it filters the images and sends them for further
processing to {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.dropimages/_processFile:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: _handleFiles

params.name: files
params.description: Array of dropped files. Only the images from this list will be processed.

params.name: editor
params.description: The current editor instance

classitems.description: Handles drag enter event. In case of IE, this function will prevent the event.
classitems.name: _onDragEnter

params.name: event
params.description: dragenter event, as received natively from CKEditor

classitems.description: Handles drag over event. In case of IE, this function will prevent the event.
classitems.name: _onDragOver

params.name: event
params.description: dragover event, as received natively from CKEditor

classitems.name: _onDragDrop

params.name: event
params.description: dragdrop event, as received natively from CKEditor

classitems.description: Prevents a native event.
classitems.name: _preventEvent

params.name: event
params.description: The event to be prevented.

classitems.description:
Processes an image file. The function creates an element and sets a source
a Data URI, then fires an event 'imagedrop' via CKEditor event system.
classitems.name: _preventEvent

params.name: event
params.description: The event to be prevented.

classitems.description: Fired when an image is being added to the editor successfully.
classitems.name: imagedrop

params.name: el
params.description: The created image with src, created as Data URI

classitems.description: Specifies the placeholder class which have to be aded to editor when editor is not focuced.
classitems.name: placeholderClass

classitems.description:
Initialization of the plugin, part of CKEditor plugin lifecycle.
The function registers a 'blur' listener to CKEditor's blur event.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editor
params.description: The current editor instance

classitems.description:
Handles the fired blur event. The function removes any data from CKEditor, because an
empty paragraph may still exist despite for the user the editor looks empty and
adds a class, specified via "placeholderClass" config attribute.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editor
params.description: Blur event, fired from CKEditor

classitems.description:
Initializer lifecycle implementation for the AlloyEditor class. Creates a CKEditor
instace, passing it the provided configuration attributes.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the editor.

classitems.description:
Destructor lifecycle implementation for the AlloyEdtor class. Destroys the CKEditor
instance and destroys all created toolbars.
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description: Retrieves the native CKEditor instance. Having this, the developer may use the API of CKEditor OOTB.
classitems.name: _getNativeEditor

return.description: The current instance of CKEditor.

classitems.description: Validates the allowed content attribute. Look [here](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.config-cfg-allowedContent) for more information about the supported values.
classitems.name: _validateAllowedContent

return.description: True if the value was accepted, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Validates toolbars attribute. May be empty string or null, which means the current instance of AlloyEdtor shouldn't
have any toolbars, or Object, which properties are the desired toolbars.
classitems.name: _validateToolbars

params.name: value
params.description: The value which should be validated.

return.description: True if the value was accepted, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Configures the allowed content for the current instance of AlloyEditor.
Look on the [official CKEditor API](http://docs.ckeditor.com/#!/api/CKEDITOR.config-cfg-allowedContent)
for more information about the valid values.
classitems.name: allowedContent

classitems.description: Retrieves the native CKEditor instance. Having this, the developer may use the full API of CKEditor.
classitems.name: nativeEditor

classitems.description:
Specifies the extra plugins which have to be loaded to the current CKEditor instance in order to
make AlloyEditor to work properly.
classitems.name: extraPlugins
placeholderClass

classitems.description:
Specifies the plugins, which come by default with CKEditor, but which are not needed by AlloyEditor.
These plugins add the default UI for CKeditor, which is no more needed. Please note that AlloyEdtor
comes with its own highly optimized copy of CKEditor (just customized via their official download page).
This version does not come with the unneeded plugins, so the value of this property won't be needed.
However, if you decide to go with the OOTB version of CKEditor, you will have to remove some of the plugins
if you decide to use AlloyEditor. Keep in mind that removing these plugins doesn't remove them entirely
from CKEditor. It just removes them from its current instance, in which you will use different UI - those of
AlloyEditor. You will be fully able to use both OOTB CKEditor and AlloyEditor on the same page!
classitems.name: removePlugins

classitems.description: The Node ID or HTMl node, which should be turned to an instance of AlloyEditor.
classitems.name: srcNode

classitems.description:
Specifies the Toolbars of the current editor instance. The value should be an object with one or more properties. Each of these will represent a toolbar. The value of these properties can be string or Object. If String, the value of the string should represent the buttons. If object, one of these properties should be 'buttons', which will represent the buttons of this Toolbar and all the other properties will be different configuration parameters of the Toolbar. Example: 

    toolbars: {
        table: { // this would be a toolbar configuration, which specifies both Toolbar attributes and its buttons
            buttons: ['button1', button2],
            width: 25
        },
        add: ['image', 'code'], // here we specify only the buttons of this toolbar and leave the other options unmodified.
        image: ['left', 'right'],
        styles: ['strong', 'em', 'u', 'h1', 'h2', 'a', 'twitter']
    }
classitems.name: toolbars

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the ButtonA class.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the editor

classitems.description:
Renders the button which handles the link creation on the current selection and
the UI, which provides input element where the user will be able to specify the
href of the link.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description:
Binds event subscriptions from the UI and the source (if assigned).
Registers a few events, like handling key press, or mouse events on
the button for clearing the link.
classitems.name: bindUI

classitems.description:
Overwrites the default implementation from {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/updateUI:method"}}{{/crossLink}}.
The button updates its "pressed" attribute and changes the UI accordingly to the presence or lack of
link style of the selection.
classitems.name: updateUI

classitems.description:
Changes position of the Toolbar, and adjusts it according to the selection,
since the width of the UI for adding/edtiting of link href  might be shorter
or larger than the default Toolbar UI.
classitems.name: _adjustHostPosition

params.name: oldHostWidth
params.description: The previous width of the host (Toolbar).

classitems.description:
Attaches a visibleChange listener on the Toolbar so the UI will commit or discard the link
if the button hides.
classitems.name: _attachHideHandler

classitems.description:
Attaches a visibleChange listener so the UI will commit or discard the link
when the button hides.
classitems.name: _onClearInputClick

classitems.description: Hides the Toolbar on clicking the close link button.
classitems.name: _onCloseLinkClick

classitems.description:
Handles the click event from the user. If button status is "pressed", activates the UI for
creating the link. Otherwise, removes the link from the current selection.
On activating the UI for link creation, a default link with href= "/" will be created and it
will be kept in button instance as _defaultLink property. This link will also have an attribute,
called "data-cke-default-link", so these links will be easily distinguished from the others.
An implementation of Link Tooltip for example may ignore these links.
classitems.name: _onClick

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user clicked on the button.

classitems.description:
Updates the default link with the real href, if any, or removes the
default link from the current selection.
See {{#crossLink "ButtonA/_onClick:method"}}{{/crossLink}} for more information
about the default link.
classitems.name: _handleLink

classitems.description: Checks if user presses Enter key and hides the Toolbar, if so.
classitems.name: _onKeyPress

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user pressed a key.

classitems.description: Shows or hides the close link button if link input contains some value.
classitems.name: _onValueChange

params.name: event
params.description:
An Event Facade object with the new and old value
of the input container.

classitems.description:
On button hide, restore the default UI for creating link.
On button show, checks if the current selection has link style or not.
If it has, activates the UI for editing link, otherwise, activates the UI
for creating a link.
classitems.name: _onValueChange

params.name: event
params.description:
An Event Facade object with the new and old value
of visible property.

classitems.description:
Removes the attached visibleChange handler on the Toolbar which
handles the commit or discard process of the link.
See {{#crossLink "ButtonA/_attachHideHandler:method"}}{{/crossLink}} for more information.
classitems.name: _removeHideHandler

classitems.description: Creates the UI for adding a link.
classitems.name: _renderLinkUI

classitems.description:
Changes the UI of the Toolbar so the user will be able to change the styles
of the selection instead to create a link.
classitems.name: _switchToTextMode

classitems.description:
Changes the UI of the Toolbar so the user will be able to to create a link to
change the styles of the selection.
classitems.name: _switchToLinkMode

params.name: link
params.description: The currently selected link from editor selection.

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description:
Collection of strings used to label elements of the button's UI.
ButtonA provides one string property, to specify the value of link placeholder.
classitems.name: strings

classitems.description:
Fired once after user clicks on the button. ButtonBase will listen to this event and
call {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/updateUI:method"}}{{/crossLink}}, so the buttons
will have chance to update their UI accordingly. For example, if user clicks on
H2 button, and then clicks on H1 button, H2 button should remove its
{{#crossLink "ButtonBase/pressed:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}, since these two styles
are mutually exclusive.
classitems.name: actionPerformed

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the ButtonBase class.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the editor

classitems.description:
Destructor lifecycle implementation for the ButtonBase class. Destroys the internal
button instance.
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description:
Renders the button UI on the host which is typically a toolbar. The protected
{{#crossLink "ButtonBase/_renderButtonUI:method"}}{{/crossLink}} will be called,
so the buttons which mix this extension will be able to overwrite the default behaviour.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description:
ButtonBase does not provide implementation, the buttons which mix this extension
may provide one.
classitems.name: bindUI

classitems.description:
Updates the toggle status of the button. If the selection has the style, specified by
the button, its status will be made active and "pressed" attribute of the button will be
set to true, otherwise, it will be set to false. ButtonStrong for example is toggleable button.
Once "updateUI" function is called, the implementation will check if style "strong" is active on
the current selection. If so, "pressed" attribute of the button will be set to true and removed
otherwise.
classitems.name: updateUI

classitems.description:
Applies the style for this button if its current status is pressed
and removes it if button is not pressed. For example, ButtonStrong will
apply style "strong" to the selection, when pressed.
classitems.name:
_onClick
protected

classitems.description:
Fires {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/actionPerformed:event"}}{{/crossLink}}. ButtonBase listens
to this event and it will call {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/updateUI:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
function, so the buttons which are mutually exclusive, like H1 and H2 will be able to
update their UI accordingly.
classitems.name: _afterClick

classitems.description:
A Toolbar should provide a container (DOM Node) where the buttons will be rendered.
By default Toolbars, which extend ToolbarBase extension will expose an attribute,
called "buttonsContainer". The value of this attribute is the container where buttons will
be rendered, so they will share common container and one button may hide the others
temporally and provide custom UI for the Toolbar.
classitems.name: _renderButtonUI

classitems.description:
Specifies if the button is toggleable, or not.
Buttons may be "toggleable" or "push" buttons.
classitems.name: toggle

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description: Fired when an image file is added as an element in the editor.
classitems.name: imageadd

params.name: el
params.description: The created img element in editor.

classitems.description:
Creates an input element of type "file" if not already created and registers
an event on input value change.
classitems.name: _getInputFile

classitems.description:
Simulates "click" event on the input field when user presses the button. This
triggers the native open file dialog from the browser. This method works on IE9+ only.
classitems.name: _onClick

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user clicked on the button.

classitems.description:
On input change, reads the chosen file and creates an img element with src as Data URI.
Then, fires an {{#crossLink "ButtonImage/imageadd:event"}}{{/crossLink}} via CKEditor
message system.
classitems.name: _onInputChange

classitems.description:
Specifies if this button will be toggleable, or not.
ButtonImage will be not toggleable by default.
classitems.name: toggle

classitems.description:
Updates "pressed" attribute of the button. If the currently selected element
is an image and this image is explicitly left aligned,
"pressed" attribute will be set to true, otherwise - to false.
classitems.name: updateUI

classitems.description:
Handles the click event. If the current status of button is "pressed",
applies "float: left" style to the image and removes "float" style otherwise.
classitems.name: _onClick

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user clicked on the button.

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description:
Updates "pressed" attribute of the button. If the currently selected element
is an image and this image is explicitly right aligned,
"pressed" attribute will be set to true, otherwise - to false.
classitems.name: updateUI

classitems.description:
Handles the click event. If the current status of button is "pressed",
applies "float: right" style to the image and removes "float" style otherwise.
classitems.name: _onClick

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user clicked on the button.

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description: Specifies the element (style) which this button handles.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description:
Overwrites the default behaviour of ButtonBase's
{{#crossLink "ButtonBase/updateUI:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method since
this button does is not toggleable.
classitems.name: updateUI

classitems.description:
Reads the selected text from the editor and opens a browser window so the
user will be able to tweet directly the text.
classitems.name: _onClick

classitems.description: Specifies if the button is toggleable, or not. ButtonTwitter will be not toggleable by default.
classitems.name: toggle

classitems.description: Specifies the URL where user can tweet the selected text.
classitems.name: tweetURL

classitems.description:
Specifies the properties of the browser window where the selected text
will appear.
classitems.name: windowProperties

classitems.description:
Specifies the title of the browser window where the selected text
will appear.
classitems.name: windowTitle

classitems.description: Specifies the style, which should be applied to the current selection in editor.
classitems.name: element

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the LinkTooltip class.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the editor

classitems.description: Destructor lifecycle implementation for the LinkTooltip class. Destroys the iattached event listeners.
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description: Renders the link tooltip node on contentBox.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description:
Attaches event listeners such as mouseenter on link elements. Links, which have
"data-cke-default-link" attribute will be ignored. These links are considered as
internal; they are being created by automatically when user triggers link creation.
See {{#crossLink "ButtonA/_onClick:method"}}{{/crossLink}} for more information.
classitems.name: bindUI

classitems.description: Adds mouseleave listener to the boundingBox.
classitems.name: _bindBBMouseLeave

classitems.description: Adds mouseenter listener to the boundingBox.
classitems.name: _bindBBMouseEnter

classitems.description:
Hides the linktooltip container after some timeout, specified by
{{#crossLink "LinkTooltip/hideTimeout:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}} attribute.
classitems.name: _attachHiddenHandle

classitems.description:
Calculates and returns the most appropriate position where link tooltip should appear.
The position depends on the specified {{#crossLink "LinkTooltip/gutter:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}},
and on the fact if the link occupies more than one line in the editor.
classitems.name: _getXY

params.name: x
params.description: Point X in page coordinates.

params.name: y
params.description: Point Y in page coordinates.

params.name: y
params.description:
The link over which the tooltip should be shown.
returns {Array} An Array with the most appropriate x and y points in page coordinates.

classitems.description:
Handles mouse enter event on the boundingBox.
Clears any already started hide handle and attaches mouse leave listener to the boundingBox.
classitems.name: _onBBMouseEnter

classitems.description:
Handles mouse leave event on the boundingBox.
Clears any already started hide handle and attaches it again.
classitems.name: _onBBMouseEnter

classitems.description: Hides the tooltip on clicking outside of the boundingBox.
classitems.name: _onClickOutside

classitems.description:
Reads the link href, updates tooltip content with the read value,
shows the tooltip and attaches mouse leave listener on the boundingBox.
classitems.name: _onLinkMouseEnter

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user positioned the mouse over the link.

classitems.description: Specifies whether the toolbar show be constrained to some node or to the viewport.
classitems.name: constrain
classitems.default: true (will be constrained to the viewport)

classitems.description: Contains the native editor implementation.
classitems.name: editor

classitems.description:
Specifies the gutter of the tooltip. The gutter object contains the top and left
offsets from the point, where the tooltip is supposed to appear.
classitems.name: gutter

classitems.description: Specifies the timeout after which the link tooltip will be hidden.
classitems.name: hideTimeout

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the UILoader plugin.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Creates instances of toolbars as specified by the editor configuration. A simple editor toolbar configuration may look like this: 

  toolbars: {
      add: ['image', 'code']
  }
In this case we have very simple configuration - the editor will have only one toolbar, with two buttons - for adding images and code into the editor. These buttons will also not have any specific configuration. In order to pass configuration attributes to the toolbars, the configuration may be specified like this: 

  toolbars: {
     add: {
          buttons: ['image', 'code'],
          zIndex: 1024
      }
  }
In this case, toolbar "add" receives two attributes - the first one is the list of buttons (each button also can be specified via an configuration object) and another attribute, which specifies its zIndex.
classitems.name: _createToolbars

classitems.description:
Retrieves a list of modules for all registered buttons and toolbars in the current
editor configuration.
The module will be automatically discovered if it follows this specification:
- if this is a Toolbar, the module should start with the word "module", followed by "-"
and then the name of the toolbar. Example: 'toolbar-add'.
- if the module is an button, then the module should start with the word "button",
followed by "-" and then the name of the button. Example: "button-image".
- In order to be instantiated successfully, the toolbar should expose itself as an object,
attached to the current YUI/AlloyUI instance. The name should start with the name Toolbar,
followed by the name of the toolbar, as specified in the configuration. Example: Y.ToolbarAdd.
- In order to be instantiated successfully, the button should expose itself as an object,
attached to the current YUI/AlloyUI instance. The name should start with the name Button,
followed by the name of the button, as specified in the configuration. Example: Y.ButtonImage.
classitems.name: _getModules

return.description:
An array of all discovered modules of toolbars and buttons, as specified by
the current editor configuration.

classitems.name: _getToolbarName

return.description: The constructed name of the Toolbar.

classitems.description: Initializer lifecycle implementation for the ToolbarAdd class.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the toolbar

classitems.description:
Attaches events to the boundingBox which will help to handle the appearance of the
menu with the buttons.
classitems.name: bindUI

classitems.description: Destroys the buttons container and its hide handler.
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description: Renders the two containers - for button add and the overlay which hosts the buttons.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description: Calculates and sets the position of the toolbar.
classitems.name: showAtPoint

params.name: x
params.description: Point X in page coordinates.

params.name: y
params.description: Point Y in page coordinates.

classitems.description: Aligns the position of buttons overlay, so it shows next to the button container.
classitems.name: _alignButtonsOverlay

classitems.description: On mouseenter event, cancels the hide listener for hiding the buttons overlay.
classitems.name: _handleMouseEnter

classitems.description: On mouseleave event, cancels and then starts again the hide listener for hiding the buttons overlay.
classitems.name: _handleMouseEnter

classitems.description: Hides the buttons overlay.
classitems.name: _hideButtonsContainer

classitems.description:
Displays or hides the toolbar when user interacts with the editor
(via mouse, keyboard or touch device).
ToolbarAdd displays itself always - regardless of the fact the selection
is empty or not. It might be hidden only if there is no any selection region.
classitems.name: _hideButtonsContainer

params.name: event
params.description: Event that triggered when user interacted with the editor.

classitems.description: Renders the button add container.
classitems.name: _renderAddNode

classitems.description: Renders the overlay which contains the buttons for adding content.
classitems.name: _renderButtonsOverlay

classitems.description:
Displays both containers - for add button and those which hosts the buttons
for adding content.
classitems.name: _showButtonsContainer

classitems.description:
Specifies the buttons, which will be attached to the current instance of the toolbar. A button configuration can be simple string with the name of the button, or an object with properties, like this: 

    buttons: ['image']
or: 

    buttons: [
        'image': {
            zIndex: 1024,
            property2: 1024
        }
    ]
classitems.name: buttons

classitems.description: Specifies whether the toolbar show be constrained to some node or to the viewport.
classitems.name: constrain
classitems.default: true (will be constrained to the viewport)

classitems.description:
Specifies the gutter of the toolbar. The gutter object contains the top and left
offsets from the point, where the toolbar is supposed to appear.
classitems.name: gutter

classitems.description: Specifies the timeout after which the buttons overlay will be hidden.
classitems.name: hideTimeout

classitems.name: initializer

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object literal for the toolbar

classitems.description: Applies transition specified via {{#crossLink "ToolbarBase/transition:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}} attribute.
classitems.name: _applyTransition

params.name: xy
params.description: The point in page coordinates where Toolbar should move.

params.name: direction
params.description:
The direction of the selection. Can be one of these:
  1. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
  2. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_BOTTOM_TO_TOP

classitems.description:
Re-fires {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/actionPerformed:event"}}{{/crossLink}} so the buttons
attached to Toolbar, which mixes this extension will be notified that user performed
an action.
classitems.name: _afterActionPerformed

params.name: event
params.description: The {{#crossLink "ButtonBase/actionPerformed:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event.

classitems.description: Returns the container in which all buttons are being rendered.
classitems.name: _getButtonsContainer

return.description: The container of all buttons attached to the current isntance of Toolbar.

classitems.description: Resolves and returns the name of the Button from the current editor configuration.
classitems.name: _getButtonInstanceName

params.name: buttonName
params.description: The name of the button as specified in Toolbar configuration.

classitems.description:
Moves the Toolbar to a point in page coordinates. If transition was specified via the
{{#crossLink "ToolbarBase/transition:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}, the movement will be
delegated to the transition, except if Toolbar is already visible. In the last case
transition will be ignored.
classitems.name: _moveToPoint

params.name: xy
params.description: The point in page coordinates where Toolbar should move.

params.name: direction
params.description:
The direction of the selection. Can be one of these:
  1. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
  2. CKEDITOR.SELECTION_BOTTOM_TO_TOP

params.name: config
params.description:
Provides additional configuration attributes to the function.
This parameter is optional. If not provided, the transition will be applied (if any).
Supported parameters are:
- visible: true or false. If toolbar is visible, the transition will be applied (if any).
If not, it will be suppressed and only the new position will be set.

The direction of the selection. May be one of the following:

classitems.description:
Calculates the position of the toolbar. Depending on the direction of the
selection, ToolbarStyles may appear above on or on bottom of the selection.
classitems.name: _calculatePosition

params.name: selectionData
params.description:
The data about the selection in the editor as
returned from {{#crossLink "CKEDITOR.plugins.selectionregion/getSelectionData:method"}}{{/crossLink}}

params.name: pos
params.description:
Contains the coordinates of the position, considered as most appropriate.
This may be the point where the user released the mouse, or just the beginning or the end of
the selection.

return.description:
An Object which contains the following properties:
direction, x, y, where x and y are in page coordinates and direction can be one of these:
CKEDITOR.SELECTION_BOTTOM_TO_TOP or CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
